definition: to dub with a nice-sounding appellation/fanciful moniker
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: South Africa Has Beautiful Scenery, Mild Climate , "Rainbow Country"Good Name.
sentences.chinese: 南非風景娟秀，天氣溫順，有“彩虹之國”的美稱。

sentences.english: The company is located in Changle city of Fuzhou, Fujian Province, the renowned "Textile City".
sentences.chinese: 公司坐落在有“紡織之鄉”美稱的福州長樂市。

sentences.english: Yuyao city, Zhejiang province is honored with the title of "Town of Moulds" and "King or Plastics"etc.
sentences.chinese: 浙江省餘姚市號稱“模具之鄉，塑料王國”等美稱。

sentences.english: Sichuan has always enjoyed the reputation of the being “Heavenly Land of Plenty”.
sentences.chinese: 四川素有“天府之國”的美稱。

sentences.english: Small fat cat has ecological garden hotel inn name.
sentences.chinese: 小肥貓客棧有着生態花園客棧的美稱。

sentences.english: Jinping County is known as "township of the pine" the laudatory name, the forestry area is quite broad.
sentences.chinese: 錦屏縣素有“杉木之鄉”的美稱，林業面積相當廣闊。

sentences.english: Therefore, potatoes have "underground apple" laudatory name.
sentences.chinese: 因此，土豆擁有“地下蘋果”的美稱。

sentences.english: Liancheng County is known as "The township of sweet potato processing in China" .
sentences.chinese: 連城縣素有“中國紅心地瓜幹之鄉”的美稱。

sentences.english: With mild spring like weather all the year around, Gulangyu is reputed as a garden on the sea.
sentences.chinese: 鼓浪嶼上氣候怡人，四季如春，素有海上花園的美稱。

sentences.english: Thus, while the urban centres have Xanadu's Huandao the laudatory name.
sentences.chinese: 因此，華麗環島有都市中心的世外桃源這一美稱。

sentences.english: Wuhu has a good name is called "1000 Lake City", which is the nature of water.
sentences.chinese: 蕪湖有個美稱叫做“千湖之城”，因而是性水的。
